key_title: Key to the species of Physalis

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Solanaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Solanaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Solanaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant perennial, growing from a rhizomatous rootstock; glabrescent or with an indumentum of simple or forked hairs
Plant annual or short-lived perennial, not growing from a rhizomatous rootstock; indumentum of sparse to dense simple (never forked) or glandular hairs
Corolla yellow; limb entire or obscurely lobed; fruiting calyx green or yellow
Corolla dull white; limb distinctly 5-lobed; fruiting calyx orange or red
Indumentum of simple hairs only; leaves elliptic, entire or obscurely lobed
Indumentum including some minute forked hairs at least on calyx-margin; leaves orbicular, ovate, ovate-lanceolate, or spathulate, coarsely dentate, sinuate, undulate or entire
Corolla throat yellow with dark purple-black spots
Corolla throat yellow or olive-yellow, without distinctive dark purple-black spots
Plant pubescent, hirsute or pilose with erect glandular or simple hairs; corolla conspicuously spotted
Plant glabrescent or sparsely pubescent with minute simple hairs; corolla marked with inconspicuous blotches
Leaves ovate-lanceolate; pedicels usually 6–10 mm long; fruiting calyx circular in section
Leaves narrow-elliptic; pedicels usually 20–30 mm long; fruiting calyx angular in section
